unnormalised: My aunt, Sunita aunty, recently decided to embrace the world of online shopping. Always a bit skeptical of technology, she was finally convinced by her daughter, Priya, after hearing about the amazing discounts during the Diwali sale on Flipkart. Her first transaction was a saree for ₹2500, quite a steal compared to what she usually pays at the local shop. She even managed to get 10% off using a coupon code, "DIWALI10".
normalised: My aunt, Sunita aunty, recently decided to embrace the world of online shopping. Always a bit skeptical of technology, she was finally convinced by her daughter, Priya, after hearing about the amazing discounts during the Diwali sale on Flipkart. Her first transaction was a saree for rupee two thousand five hundred, quite a steal compared to what she usually pays at the local shop. She even managed to get ten percent off using a coupon code, D-I-W-A-L-I-ten.

unnormalised: The initial excitement, however, soon turned into mild panic. The estimated delivery date was 25/10/2024, and Sunita aunty kept checking the tracking info every 2 hours. She even called the customer care number listed on the website, +91-80-12345678, multiple times, just to confirm that her order was indeed on its way. She was particularly worried because she had entered her UPI ID incorrectly the first time and had to re-do the payment. The second transaction went through, deducting ₹2250 from her account.

She was particularly worried because she had entered her U-P-I I-D incorrectly the first time and had to redo the payment. unnormalised: Then came the deluge of notifications. OTPs, transaction confirmations, and promotional messages flooded her phone. She wasn't sure which were genuine and which weren't. One message claimed she had won a lottery of Rs. 50,000, but required her to transfer Rs. 5000 as a processing fee. Priya quickly intervened, explaining that it was a scam and to ignore such messages. "Never, ever give out your bank details, Amma," she cautioned.

unnormalised: The saree finally arrived a day early, on 24/10/2024, much to Sunita aunty's delight. It was exactly as pictured on the website, a vibrant silk saree perfect for the festive season. Overjoyed, she decided to order a new kurta for her husband, Rakesh uncle, this time priced at Rs. 1800, but this time she made Priya sit beside her to make sure everything went smoothly.

unnormalised: Sunita aunty's foray into e-commerce, though initially stressful, ended on a positive note. She learned valuable lessons about online safety and the convenience of shopping from home. She still prefers her trusted local shop for certain items, but for those big Diwali sales, she's now a pro, navigating discounts and coupon codes like a seasoned online shopper. Her next goal is to learn how to use Paytm properly, but that’s a story for another day.
